intro: Alchornea humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's alchornea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathium structures, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
